Class RiskyStrategy

java.lang.Object
strategy.RiskyStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlayStrategy
public class RiskyStrategy extends Object implements IPlayStrategy
Implements an aggressive play strategy for AI players. This strategy focuses on maximizing potential points by preferring hearts and jokers, which are typically worth more points in the Jest game.

Strategy behavior:

  • When hiding cards: prioritizes hiding hearts or jokers
  • When picking cards: targets visible hearts or jokers
  • Seeks high-value cards to maximize scoring potential
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • makeChoice

      public int makeChoice(int min, int max, ArrayList<Card> cards, boolean isHidingCard)
      Makes a strategic choice for the AI player based on aggressive, high-risk play.

      When hiding a card (isHidingCard = true):

      • Returns 1 if the first card is a heart or joker (hide it)
      • Returns 2 otherwise (hide the second card)

      When picking a card (isHidingCard = false):

      • Searches for visible hearts or jokers and returns their position (1-indexed)
      • Returns 0 if no suitable card is found
      Specified by:
      makeChoice in interface IPlayStrategy
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum value in the valid range (not used in this strategy)
      max - the maximum value in the valid range (not used in this strategy)
      cards - the list of cards to choose from
      isHidingCard - true if the AI is hiding a card, false if picking a card
      Returns:
      the 1-indexed position of the chosen card, or 0 if no suitable choice is found
